keywords.indexterm: Using your own Content Fusion Enterprise server

body.p: The information in this topic is meant to help system administrators install and configure your own Enterprise server solution.

section.title: Types of Server Connections
section.p:
The Oxygen Content Fusion Connector add-on supports two types of server connections:
(https://fusion.oxygenxml.com) This solution is a service where content that is uploaded through the connector add-on is stored on a public server hosted by Oxygen. This solution allows you to try for free but you cannot control the server configuration and your documents will be uploaded to a shared server (it is recommended that you use sample documents that do not contain sensitive information or ownership rights).
It is also possible (and usually preferable) to use your own server to store uploaded content. This solution allows you to host your own server to store content that is uploaded through the connector add-on. With this model, you will be able to set up and configure your own server. This solution also allows you to upload custom frameworks so that all contributors will have access to them when reviewing content in .

section.title: Supported Enterprise Server Deployment Solutions
section.p:
The solution supports the following types of server deployments:
Your Own Server using VMware vSphere This type of deployment is preferable for organizations that have their own server hardware and server administrators who are familiar with the VMware vSphere Virtual Manager.
A Server Hosted on Amazon Web Services
This is preferable for organizations that prefer a cloud-based setup and already have their infrastructure running on Amazon's Web Service. This solution requires an AWS account and the setup requires resources that are not covered in Amazon's free tier.
Other Platforms using an Installation Kit This type of deployment is preferable for organizations that are using other platforms other than VMware vSphere or another cloud provider other than Amazon. The installation kit for this solution has been built to run on Ubuntu 18.04.
